intro: Anemonidium obtusilobum, commonly known as the broad-lobed anemonidium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that are broadly ovate with rounded lobes, giving it its common name. It produces showy, yellowish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. Anemonidium obtusilobum is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
